intro: Rorippa behcetii, commonly known as the Behcet's watercress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, bright green, floating leaves and tiny white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to parts of Central Asia, this species thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. The plant has a short life cycle and is often found in wetlands, where it plays a role in aquatic ecosystems. Its seeds are dispersed by water, contributing to its distribution across suitable habitats.
